headline.main: ST. THOMAS; Yellow Fever in the Island of St. Thomas -- Deaths of Americans--The Rebellion in Tortoin &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: I perceive that very imperfect and general accounts have reached the States of the yellow fever prevailing for some time past on our island. Previous to the Fall of 1852, we had enjoyed, for many years, entire freedom from this dreadful disease. The Summer of 1852 was very wet,

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Roving valetudinarians, restless dyspeptics, and ridiculous health-seekers, who are never so well but a medicated water will make them better; who are ever on the alert for springs impregnated with an appreciable quantity of iron, an homeopathic solution of iodine, or the more sensible qualities of sulphuretted hydrogen--will read with joy the announcement that the Croton water is medicated.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Health has already informed the public that the yellow fever exists among us. We shall endeavor, while it lasts, to keep our readers accurately advised of its progress. so that there will be no occasion for the usual exaggeration in regard to it. We see nothing to be gained and much to be lost by concealments or misrepresentations.

docs.lead_paragraph: MR. WEED'S REPLY TO DR. FOOTE'S CARD. Persons charged with offences almost invariably betray themselves if they attempt to explain. Hence, by a humane provision of law, when arraigned, they are permitted to stand mute, after simply pleading "not guilty."

headline.main: Comparative Mortality of New York and Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: If anything would reconcile us to the frightful mortality reported for the last week from the City Inspector's Office, it would be the fact that our amiable neighbor, Philadelphia, lays the list so like a flattering unction to its soul. It reads it daily, to all appearances; and its staidest papers throw up their hats and hurrah, after the comparison with their own mortal statistics.

docs.lead_paragraph: New-Orleans papers of Wednesday last are received. They say nothing as to the reported burning of bodies in that city. The body of a murdered man, partially cut up, supposed to be a returned Californian, had been found under mysterious circumstances, beneath one of the wharves of New-Orleans.

headline.main: The Excursion of the Bininger Guards.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bininger Guards, Capt. DAVID HARRIS, of New-York, arrived at 1 o'clock P. M., under escort of the Elmira Guards, in good health and spirits. They have taken apartments at the Inter national Hotel. The corps visited the Canada side this afternoon, and were enthusiastically received. They have a grand banquet to-night at the International.
